description:
An intensive introductory laboratory course in organismal biology. 

BIOL 124 is the companion course to BIOL 121 and may be taken before or after BIOL 121. Students may not take both BIOL 102 and 124 for credit. 

Lab fee $150.
name: INTRO ORGANISM BIOL. LAB

values.comments:
This intensive introductory laboratory course emphasizes how molecular biology has revolutionized our understanding of cell and organism functions. 

Many students commented that this course was very interesting and "thoroughly enjoyable." Students stated that they learned a lot and several students even said that that the class was "quite fun." 

Students praised Professor Robinson for her enthusiasm and accessibility, stating she was "always around, even to just stop her in the hall to ask questions." Students also said Professor Robinson’s lectures were very informative.

This course is generally taken before or after BIOL121. Students recommended the course to "all biology majors" and anyone else, especially pre-meds, interested in physiology and/or medicine. Students reported spending varying amounts of time for this class, but many students found the amount of work to be disproportionate with the designation of only 0.5 cu. The lab practical at the end of the year is based largely on memorization as opposed to application.
